title: Album Page, "Sketches of Second Loggia, Campanile of San Zeno, Verona, Italy", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper, folded and tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 126; bottom right corner: 119; upper left edge: 2nd lojia; bottom right of drawings: San Zeno / Verona.  Many other inscriptions with dimensions throughout.
dimensions: Sheet: 31 x 20.6 cm (12 3/16 x 8 1/8 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet illustrating a view in plan of the second loggia of the campanile, consisting of four sides each with a triple arcade supported by two slender columns. To the right of this is part of a tabernacle-like structure seen in section, consisting of a steeply angled roof with a small turret on the right corner, supported by a column and cuboidal capital.  Below this is a detail of the column support of the loggia including dimensions of various components.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Second Loggia, Campanile of San Zeno, Verona, Italy", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper, folded and tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-295.
